ACE2-: is known both for controlling the blood pressure and by serving as entry receptor of some viruses.
REN--: is produced by the kidneys to regulate blood pressure.
IL3--: is a cytokine produced by some T cells.
PGR--: encodes the receptor of an important hormone.
SST--: is a hormone gene expressed by cells throughout the digestive system.
IL5--: is a cytokine related to allergic diseases.
NR3C1: is the receptor of a hormone produced in the adrenal cortex.
ACHE-: encodes an enzyme that metabolizes a neurotransmitter.
CHAT-: encodes an enzyme that transfers an acetyl group.
IL15-: belongs to the four alpha-helix bundle family of cytokines.
GHRL-: is expressed by enteroendocrine cells and acts stimulating the appetite.
AGT--: encodes a peptide hormone that causes an increase in blood pressure.
TP53-: plays a role in the control of the cell cycle.
ALB--: encodes an abundant globular serum protein
CRH--: is expressed by the paraventricular nucleus (PVN) of the hypothalamus in response to stress.
RHO--: encodes a G-protein coupled receptor that is also a biological pigment.
IL13-: encodes a cytokine related to allergic diseases.
CFP--: encodes a glycoprotein that participates in the complement system.
IL7--: is known for its importance to lymphocyte development..
TLR4-: is well known for recognizing lipopolysaccharide (LPS).
KLK3-: encodes an important biomarker for prostate diseases.
SRY--: is located on the short arm of the Y chromosome.
CCK--: plays a role in stimulating digestion.
TTN--: is expressed by muscles and encodes the largest known protein.
ELN--: is important for the mechanical properties of human skin.
SCT--: is expressed by the S cells of the duodenum.
IGF2-: encodes one hormone structurally similar to insulin.
LALBA: regulates the production of lactose in the milk.
NEB--: when mutated, causes the congenital disease nemaline myopathy.
STAT3: encodes a transcription factor phosphorylated by Janus kinases and essential for Th17 cells.
FASLG: plays a role in the induction of apoptosis.
CASP1: encodes an enzyme with a core role in pyroptosis.
FBN1-: when mutated, causes the connective tissue disorder Marfan syndrome.
MDM2-: encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that controls the activity of p53.
HTR2A: encodes a target of psychedelic drugs like LSD and psilocybin.
FURIN: is known for its role in the proteolytic cleavage of viral envelope proteins.
F8---: plays an essential role in blood clotting, with defects leading to hemophilia A.
TNF--: encodes an adipokine and cytokine with immunostimulant properties.
MAPT-: encodes a protein present in neurofibrillary tangles in some neurodegenerative diseases.
ACE--: is known for its role in the renin-angiotensin system.
EZR--: encodes a protein called cytovillin, present in microvilli.
KEL--: encodes the core protein of the Kell Cellano blood group system
CD5--: is known for its ability to mark T cells, but with less sensitivity than CD3.
IL11-: encodes a cytokine also known as adipogenesis inhibitory factor.
DRD1-: is expressed by neurons in the dorsal striatum.
IL22-: is a member of the IL-10 superfamily.
APOB-: encodes one major proteic component of chylomicrons.
DRD2-: encodes a receptor of several antipsychotic drugs.
PRNP-: is associated with the kuru neurodegenerative disease.
IL2--: is known for its role in the activation of lymphocytes.
POMC-: encodes a protein that can be cleaved into multiple peptide hormones.
GPT--: encodes a transaminase that plays a role in gluconeogenesis.
CBLIF: is important for the absorption of vitamin B12.
APOA2: encodes an abundant protein in high-dentisity lipoprotein particles.
CP---: encodes the major copper-carrying protein in the blood.
HAMP-: plays a role in iron metabolism.
CD38-: is expressed by many immune cells and the target of the drug daratumumab.
TGM2-: encodes the autoantigen in celiac disease.
NOD1-: encodes a protein with a caspase recruitment domain (CARD).
LHB--: encodes a chain of a gonadotropin hormone.
KRAS-: is a proto-oncogene associated with colorectal cancer.
RDX--: encodes a cytoskeletal protein similar to ezrin and moesin.
RAN--: plays a role  in transport into and out of the cell nucleus during interphase.
BRAF-: is a proto-oncogene also associated with cardiofaciocutaneous syndrome.
BMP2-: encodes a morphogenic protein witha role in osteoblast differentiation.
HADHA: encodes a mitochontrial protein envolved with beta-oxidation.
MANBA: encodes an enzyme of the glycosyl hydrolase 2 family.
DRD4-: encodes a neurotransmitter receptor associated with novelty seeking.
PMCH-: is expressed by the hypothalamus and is related to hunger.
PAX6-: is essential for the formation of the retina, lens and cornea.
IL1RN: encodes the inhibitor of an important interleukin.
PPARG: is activated by thiazolidinediones, insulin sensitizing drugs.
GNAS-: leads to several transcripts and has a highly complex imprinted expression pattern.
G6PD-: when mutated causes favism, an hemolytic response to eating fava beans.
APC--: is associated with familial adenomatous polyposis.
